column1: Team narrative: successes and pain points
column6: Clearly identifies top 3 successes and top 3 pain points; descriptions are specific and non-generic.
column9: Successes/pain points are identified but some are vague or incomplete.
column12: Missing or too vague to evaluate.

column6: Reads as a coherent narrative with synthesis (not a status list); shows prioritization and a clear “story of the term.”
column9: Mostly coherent; some sections drift into status updates.

column1: Team narrative: causal analysis (why it happened)
column6: Provides plausible causes for major successes/pain points; causes are grounded in team behavior/process.
column9: Some causal explanation exists but is thin or partly speculative.

column6: Clear insights about team dynamics (communication, decision-making, coordination, accountability, workload balance, inclusion) tied to examples.
column9: Mentions team dynamics but connections to examples are light.

column6: At least one concise artifact directly supports key narrative claims (technical and/or team/process artifacts are acceptable) and is clearly chosen to reinforce the most important successes/pain points.
column9: At least one artifact supports the narrative; relevance is partial or the selection doesn’t clearly support the most important claims.

column1: Action plan: three actions and realism
column6: At least three actions; each is concise, realistic, and clearly addresses a pain point or reinforces a success.
column9: Actions exist but some are vague or not clearly connected to the narrative.
column12: Missing actions or actions are not actionable.

column6: Each action has a single owner and a clear timeframe.
Each action includes a plain-language recognition cue showing what success looks like.
column9: Some success criteria exist but are vague.

column1: Individual pages: wins, gaps, and example quality
column6: 1–2 wins and 1–2 gaps are clearly tied to the student’s owned area, with at least one concrete example; includes brief analysis of what helped or hurt performance.
column9: Wins/gaps and an example exist, but ties to owned area and/or analysis are thin.
column12: Generic wins/gaps and/or missing concrete example; little to no analysis.

column6: Two commitments are realistic and actionable, each includes how progress will be checked (date/event/cue) and a clearly observable outcome.
column9: Two commitments exist but one or more pieces are vague (action, check-in cue, or observable outcome).
column12: Fewer than two commitments, or commitments are not actionable/checkable.

column6: Identifies one specific, plausible blocker and includes a clear mitigation step the student will lead, a simple trigger for when to act, and a concrete “helped” cue.
column9: Blocker and mitigation exist, but specificity/trigger/helped cue are partly vague.
column12: Blocker is generic or missing, or mitigation/trigger/helped cue are missing.

column6: Concise, well-structured, polished; uses clear headings and bullets; stays close to the expected core length (team sections ~1–2 pages plus individual pages) while still being complete; screenshots/visuals enhance readability.
column9: Mostly clear with some structure; minor readability issues or slightly off-target length.

column6: Professional tone; narrative claims are precise and easy to follow; actions/commitments use consistent formatting and are written in checkable, verifiable language.
column9: Generally clear; occasional ambiguity, inconsistent formatting, or awkward wording.
column12: Unclear or unprofessional tone; inconsistent or confusing writing.

column6: Images/screenshots are legible and include alt text and short captions that explain what the evidence shows and why it matters; links use descriptive text; private links include lightweight screenshots/snippets so graders can evaluate.
column9: Some accessibility practices are used; minor gaps (e.g., missing some alt text/captions, captions lack context, or vague link text).
column12: Missing alt text/captions or inaccessible formatting; evidence not evaluable due to inaccessible/private links.
